title: Letter: A Russian's personal view of the sanctions regime
text:
If speech is silver, silence is golden. That's what comes to mind when all parties to an oil deal do not comment on it (“Russia ships crude to India despite rejecting G7 price cap”, Report, December 17).

A price cap, especially a symbolic G7 one, is always a half-measure compared to an embargo since if the US can do without Cuban products, the world can't do without Russian mineral resources.

And there is a difference between what you describe as pain at the pump and, say, a Russian's experience of now being unable to travel abroad three times a year or buy an iPhone as soon as a new model arrives.

Besides, as a Russian I'm aware that being under sanctions is what comes with the territory in my country, the largest land-grabber in the world.

So we are accustomed to them as the Japanese are accustomed to earthquakes.

Mergen Mongush
Moscow, Russia
